t: For the choir director: “Do Not Destroy.” A Miktam of David. When he fled before Saul into the cave.
Be*pn gracious to me, God, be gracious to me, for*ln I take refuge in you. I*ln will seek refuge in the shadow of your wings until*ln danger passes.
I*ln call to God Most High, to*ln God who fulfills his purpose for me.
He*ln reaches down from heaven and saves me, challenging*ln the one who tramples me. Selah*ig God*ln sends his faithful love and truth.
I*ln am surrounded by lions; I*ln lie down among devouring lions — people*ln whose teeth are spears and arrows, whose*ln tongues are sharp swords.
God,*ln be exalted above the heavens; let*ln your glory be over the whole earth.
They*ln prepared a net for my steps; I*ln was despondent. They*ln dug a pit ahead of me, but*ln they fell into it! Selah*ig
My*pn heart is confident, God, my heart is confident. I*ln will sing; I will sing praises.
Wake*ln up, my soul! Wake*ln up, harp and lyre! I*ln will wake up the dawn.
I*ln will praise you, Lord, among the peoples; I*ln will sing praises to you among the nations.
For*ln your faithful love is as high as the heavens; your*ln faithfulness reaches the clouds.
God,*ln be exalted above the heavens; let*ln your glory be over the whole earth.
